title: 1952–53 in Belgian football
text:
The 1952–53 season was the 50th season of competitive <a href="association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a>. <a href="R.F.C.%20de%20Li%C3%A8ge">RFC Liégeois</a> won their 5th <a href="Belgian%20First%20Division">Division I</a> title. This was the first season since the 1952 reform of the national competitions. A new level of football was introduced at the top of the <a href="Belgian%20football%20league%20system">league system</a>. The divisions were also renamed, with the top level being named Division I (one league of 16 teams), the second level Division II (one league of 16 teams), the 3rd level Division III (2 leagues of 16 teams each) and the lowest level remaining the Promotion (4 leagues of 16 teams each). The <a href="Belgium%20national%20football%20team">Belgium national football team</a> played 6 friendly games (3 wins, 3 losses) and then started their <a href="1954%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">1954 FIFA World Cup qualification</a> campaign with 2 away wins in <a href="Finland%20national%20football%20team">Finland</a> and <a href="Sweden%20national%20football%20team">Sweden</a>.
Overview.
At the end of the season, <a href="R.R.C.%20Gent-Zeehaven">RRC de Gand</a> and <a href="K.%20Beringen%20F.C.">Beringen FC</a> were relegated to <a href="Belgian%20Second%20Division">Division II</a> and were replaced in <a href="Belgian%20Pro%20League">Division I</a> by 2 clubs from <a href="Lier%2C%20Belgium">Lier</a>: Division II winner <a href="K.%20Lyra">K Lyra</a> and runner-up <a href="K.%20Lierse%20S.K.">K Lierse SK</a>.<br>
The bottom 2 clubs in Division II (<a href="K.F.C.%20Ronse">FC Renaisien</a> and <a href="K.%20Stade%20Leuven">Stade Louvain</a>) were relegated to Division III, while both Division III winners (<a href="K.%20Tubantia%20Borgerhout%20V.K.">K Tubantia FC</a> and <a href="R.%20Uccle%20Sport">R Uccle Sport</a>) qualified for Division II.<br>
The bottom club of each Division III league were relegated to Promotion: <a href="K.F.C.%20Helzold">Helzold FC</a>, <a href="K.F.C.%20Mol">K Mol Sport</a>, <a href="R.A.A.%20Louvi%C3%A9roise">RAA Louviéroise</a> and <a href="K.S.K.%20Halle">Union Halloise</a>, to be replaced by <a href="K.%20Sint-Niklase%20S.K.E.">K Sint-Niklaasse SK</a>, <a href="R.C.S.%20La%20Forestoise">RCS La Forestoise</a>, <a href="S.R.U.%20Verviers">SRU Verviers</a> and <a href="K.V.C.%20Willebroek-Meerhof">K Willebroekse SV</a>.
